snippet: Describing what occurred as a kidnapping, President Juan Manuel Santos said that he had directed the country’s peace negotiators not to travel to Havana for a new round of talks with the guerrillas.
abstract: Colombian Pres Juan Manuel Santos suspends negotiations with Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, country's main rebel group, and accuses it of kidnapping army general Ruben Dario Alzate and two other people; it is first major setback in peace talks intended to end 50 years of guerrilla warfare.

byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

lead_paragraph: Describing what occurred as a kidnapping, President Juan Manuel Santos said that he had directed the country’s peace negotiators not to travel to Havana for a new round of talks with the guerrillas.

headline.main: President of Colombia Halts Peace Talks With Rebels After General Is Seized
headline.print_headline: President of Colombia Halts Peace Talks With Rebels After General Is Seized
